unnormalised: New Delhi – The rollout of Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure across India continues at a rapid pace, driven by increased demand for high-speed internet services. Bharat Broadband Network Limited (BBNL) announced further expansion plans on 10/10/2024, aiming to connect an additional 50,000 Gram Panchayats by the end of fiscal year 2025. This initiative directly supports the Digital India campaign and aims to bridge the digital divide, particularly in rural areas like Uttar Pradesh and Bihar.
normalised: New Delhi – The rollout of Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) infrastructure across India continues at a rapid pace, driven by increased demand for high-speed internet services. Bharat Broadband Network Limited (B B N L) announced further expansion plans on tenth october two thousand and twenty four, aiming to connect an additional fifty thousand Gram Panchayats by the end of fiscal year two thousand and twenty five. This initiative directly supports the Digital India campaign and aims to bridge the digital divide, particularly in rural areas like Uttar Pradesh and Bihar.

unnormalised: Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel, key players in the telecom sector, are also aggressively expanding their FTTH networks. JioFiber reported connecting over 7 million homes as of 30/09/2024, while Airtel Xstream Fiber is focusing on enhancing its presence in Tier-II and Tier-III cities. Analysts predict that FTTH subscriptions will surpass 50 million by mid-2026, fueled by competitive pricing and bundled service offerings. The average data consumption per user is projected to reach 25 GB per month.
normalised: Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel, key players in the telecom sector, are also aggressively expanding their F T T H networks. JioFiber reported connecting over seven million homes as of thirtieth september two thousand and twenty four, while Airtel Xstream Fiber is focusing on enhancing its presence in Tier-two and Tier-three cities. Analysts predict that F T T H subscriptions will surpass fifty million by mid-two thousand and twenty six, fueled by competitive pricing and bundled service offerings. The average data consumption per user is projected to reach twenty five G B per month.

unnormalised: A seminar on “Future of FTTH in India” is scheduled at IIT-Bombay on 15/11/2024 at 10:00 hrs, bringing together industry experts and policymakers to discuss challenges and opportunities in the sector. The government is exploring further incentives to encourage private sector investment in FTTH infrastructure, especially in remote and underserved regions, which can boost local economies and enable e-governance initiatives.
normalised: A seminar on “Future of F T T H in India” is scheduled at I I T-Bombay on fifteenth november two thousand and twenty four at ten o’clock, bringing together industry experts and policymakers to discuss challenges and opportunities in the sector. The government is exploring further incentives to encourage private sector investment in F T T H infrastructure, especially in remote and underserved regions, which can boost local economies and enable e-governance initiatives.
